member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.InstallSpeckleFolderPath
member.summary: Returns the correct location of the Speckle installation folder. Usually this would be the user's %appdata%/Speckle folder, unless the install was made for all users.
member.returns: The location of the Speckle installation folder

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.UserSpeckleFolderPath
member.summary: Returns the correct location of the Speckle folder for the current user. Usually this would be the user's %appdata%/Speckle folder.
member.returns: The location of the Speckle installation folder

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.InstallApplicationDataPath
member.summary: Returns the correct location of the AppData folder where Speckle is installed. Usually this would be the user's %appdata% folder, unless the install was made for all users. This folder contains Kits and othe data that can be shared among users of the same machine.
member.returns: The location of the AppData folder where Speckle is installed

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.UserApplicationDataPath
member.summary: Returns the location of the User Application Data folder for the current roaming user, which contains user specific data such as accounts and cache.
member.returns: The location of the user's `%appdata%` folder.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.Receive(System.String,Speckle.Core.Credentials.Account,System.Action{System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary{System.String,System.Int32}},System.Action{System.String,System.Exception},System.Action{System.Int32})
member.summary: Helper method to Receive from a Speckle Server.
member.param: Stream URL or Id to receive from. If the URL contains branchName, commitId or objectId those will be used, otherwise the latest commit from main will be received.
Account to use. If not provided the default account will be used.
Action invoked on progress iterations.
Action invoked on internal errors.
Action invoked once the total count of objects is known.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.Send(System.String,Speckle.Core.Models.Base,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Speckle.Core.Credentials.Account,System.Boolean,System.Action{System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary{System.String,System.Int32}},System.Action{System.String,System.Exception})
member.summary: Helper method to Send to a Speckle Server.
member.param: Stream URL or Id to send to. If the URL contains branchName, commitId or objectId those will be used, otherwise the latest commit from main will be received.
Data to send
Account to use. If not provided the default account will be used.
Toggle for the default cache. If set to false, it will only send to the provided transports.
Action invoked on progress iterations.
Action invoked on internal errors.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Api.Helpers.IsConnectorUpdateAvailable(System.String)
member.param: The connector slug eg. revit, rhino, etc

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Api.Operations.GetSerializerInstance
member.summary: Convenience method to instantiate an instance of the default object serializer and settings pre-populated with it.
Receives an object from a transport.
member.param: The transport to receive from.
Leave null to use the default cache.
Action invoked on progress iterations.
Action invoked on internal errors.
Action invoked once the total count of objects is known.

member.summary: Receives an object from a transport.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to send notice of cancellation.
The transport to receive from.
Leave null to use the default cache.
Action invoked on progress iterations.
Action invoked on internal errors.
Action invoked once the total count of objects is known.

member.summary: Sends an object via the provided transports. Defaults to the local cache.
member.param: The object you want to send.
Where you want to send them.
Toggle for the default cache. If set to false, it will only send to the provided transports.
Action that gets triggered on every progress tick (keeps track of all transports).
Use this to capture and handle any errors from within the transports.
member.returns: The id (hash) of the object.

member.summary: Sends an object via the provided transports. Defaults to the local cache.
member.param: The object you want to send.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to send notice of cancellation.
Where you want to send them.
Toggle for the default cache. If set to false, it will only send to the provided transports.
Action that gets triggered on every progress tick (keeps track of all transports).
Use this to capture and handle any errors from within the transports.
member.returns: The id (hash) of the object.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Credentials.StreamWrapper.GetAccount
member.summary:
Gets a valid account for this stream wrapper.
Note: this method ensures that the stream exists and/or that the user has an account which has access to that stream. If used in a sync manner, make sure it's not blocking.
member.exception: Throws exception if account fetching failed. This could be due to non-existent account or stream.
member.returns: The valid account object for this stream.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Helpers.Http.UserHasInternet
member.summary: Checks if the user has a valid internet connection by first pinging cloudfare (fast) and then trying get from the default Speckle server (slower) Each check is retried 3 times
member.returns: True if the user is connected to the internet, false otherwise.

member.summary: Pings a specific url to verify it's accessible. Retries 3 times.

member.summary: Pings and tries gettign data from a specific address to verify it's online. Retries 3 times.
member.param: The address to use
member.returns: True if the the status code is successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Logging.Analytics.TrackEvent(Speckle.Core.Logging.Analytics.Events,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tracks an event without specifying the email and server. It's not always possible to know which account the user has selected, especially in visual programming. Therefore we are caching the email and server values so that they can be used also when nodes such as "Serialize" are used. If no account info is cached, we use the default account data.
member.param: Name of the even
Additional parameters to pass in to event
True if it's an action performed by a logged user

member.summary: Tracks an event from a specified account, anonymizes personal information
member.param: Account to use, it will be anonymized
Name of the event
Additional parameters to pass to the event
True if it's an action performed by a logged user

summary.para: Flags an object's property as being detachable.
If set to true the default serialiser will persist it separately, and add a reference to the property's value in the original object.
Only applies to properties of types derived from the Base class.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.DetachProperty.#ctor(System.Boolean)

summary.para: Flags an object's property as being detachable.
If set to true the default serialiser will persist it separately, and add a reference to the property's value in the original object.
Only applies to properties of types derived from the Base class.

member.param: Wether to detach the property or not.

member.name: T:Speckle.Core.Models.Chunkable
member.summary:
Flags a list or array as splittable into chunks during serialisation. These chunks will be recomposed on deserialisation into the original list. Note: this attribute should be used in conjunction with .
Use this attribute on properties that can become very long and are not worth detaching into individual elements.
Objects per chunk: for simple types, like numbers, use a high value (>10000); for other objects, use a more conservative number depending on their serialised size.

member.name: T:Speckle.Core.Models.Base
member.summary:
Base class for all Speckle object definitions. Provides unified hashing, type extraction and serialisation.
When developing a speckle kit, use this class as a parent class.
Dynamic properties naming conventions:
"__" at the start of a property means it will be ignored, both for hashing and serialisation (e.g., "__ignoreMe").
"@" at the start of a property name means it will be detached (when serialised with a transport) (e.g.((dynamic)obj)["@meshEquivalent"] = ...) .

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.id
member.summary:
A speckle object's id is an unique hash based on its properties.
NOTE: this field will be null unless the object was deserialised from a source. Use the function to get it.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.totalChildrenCount
member.summary: This property will only be populated if the object is retreieved from storage. Use otherwise.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.applicationId
member.summary: Secondary, ideally host application driven, object identifier.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.speckle_type
member.summary: Holds the type information of this speckle object, derived automatically from its assembly name and inheritance.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.GetId(System.Boolean,Speckle.Core.Api.SerializerVersion)
member.summary:
Gets the id (a unique hash) of this object. This method fully serializes the object, which in the case of large objects (with many sub-objects), has a tangible cost. Avoid using it!
Hint: Objects that are retrieved/pulled from a server/local cache do have an id (hash) property pre-populated.
Note:The hash of a decomposed object differs from the hash of a non-decomposed object.
member.param: If true, will decompose the object in the process of hashing.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.GetTotalChildrenCount
member.summary: Attempts to count the total number of detachable objects.
member.returns: The total count of the detachable children + 1 (itself).

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.Base.ShallowCopy
member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of the current base object. This operation does NOT copy/duplicate the data inside each prop. The new object's property values will be pointers to the original object's property value.
member.returns: A shallow copy of the original object.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.Blob.id
member.summary: For blobs, the id is the same as the file hash. Please note, when deserialising, the id will be set from the original hash generated on sending.

member.name: T:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase
member.summary:
Base class implementing a bunch of nice dynamic object methods, like adding and removing props dynamically. Makes c# feel like json.
Orginally adapted from Rick Strahl
https://weblog.west-wind.com/posts/2012/feb/08/creating-a-dynamic-extensible-c-expando-object

member.name: F:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase.DefaultIncludeMembers
member.summary: Default value for

member.name: F:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase.properties
member.summary: The actual property bag, where dynamically added props are stored.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase.Item(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets and gets properties using the key accessor pattern. E.g.:
((dynamic)myObject)["superProperty"] = 42;

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary:
Gets properties via the dot syntax.
((dynamic)myObject).superProperty;

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.DynamicBase.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary:
Sets properties via the dot syntax.
((dynamic)myObject).superProperty = something;

member.name: T:Speckle.Core.Models.Extensions.BaseExtensions.BaseRecursionBreaker
member.summary: Provides access to each base object in the traverse function, and decides whether the traverse function should continue traversing it's children or not.
member.remarks: Should return 'true' if you wish to stop the traverse behaviour, 'false' otherwise.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.Extensions.BaseExtensions.Flatten(Speckle.Core.Models.Base,Speckle.Core.Models.Extensions.BaseExtensions.BaseRecursionBreaker)
member.summary: Traverses through the object and its children. Only traverses through the first occurrence of a object (to prevent infinite recursion on circular references)
member.param: The root object of the tree to flatten
Optional predicate function to determine whether to break (or continue) traversal of a object's children.
member.returns: A flat List of objects.

member.name: M:Speckle.Core.Models.Extensions.BaseExtensions.Traverse(Speckle.Core.Models.Base,Speckle.Core.Models.Extensions.BaseExtensions.BaseRecursionBreaker)
member.summary: Depth-first traversal of the specified object and all of its children as a deferred Enumerable, with a function to break the traversal.
member.param: The object to traverse.
Predicate function to determine whether to break (or continue) traversal of a object's children.
member.returns: Deferred Enumerable of the objects being traversed (iterable only once).

member.name: T:Speckle.Core.Models.Abstract
member.summary:
Wrapper around other, third party, classes that are not coming from a speckle kit.
Serialization and deserialization of the base object happens through default Newtonsoft converters. If your object does not de/serialize correctly, this class will not prevent that from happening.
Limitations:
- Base object needs to be serializable.
- Inline collection declarations with values do not behave correctly.
- Your class needs to have a void constructor.
- Probably more. File a bug!

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ApplicationObject.OriginalId
member.summary: The Speckle id (on receive) or native id (on send)

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ApplicationObject.Descriptor
member.summary: A descriptive string to describe the object. Use the object type as default.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ApplicationObject.CreatedIds
member.summary: The created object ids associated with this object

member.summary: Conversion status of object

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ApplicationObject.Log
member.summary: Conversion notes or other important information to expose to the user

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ApplicationObject.Converted

member.summary: Keeps track of the conversion process

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ProgressReport.ConversionErrors
member.summary: Keeps track of errors in the conversions.

member.name: P:Speckle.Core.Models.ProgressReport.OperationErrors
member.summary: Keeps track of HANDLED errors that occur during send/recieve commands.
member.remarks: Handled errors specific to the conversion, should be added to ConversionErrors Unhandleable errors (i.e. that lead to the entire send/receive failing) should be Thrown instead.
